means: 护根（用以保持水分、消灭杂草等的覆盖物，如稻草、腐叶或塑料膜）
用护根覆盖（植物根部或其周围地面）

sentence.Network_en: In May, mulch the bed with garden compost.
I used stable muck as a mulch for my roses.
sentence.Network_cn: 我用厩肥做我玫瑰的护根.

sentence.Network_en: A loose mulch acts on the surface as an insulator.
sentence.Network_cn: 疏松的覆盖物在土壤表面起了隔热的作用.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: probably from dialect mulch 'soft' used as a noun, from Old English melsc, mylsc

entry.tran: 盖料，覆盖层(置于植物周围土壤上助其生长的枯树叶、小树枝或粪肥)
entry.def: A mulch is a layer of something such as old leaves, small pieces of wood, or manure which you put on the soil round plants in order to protect them and help them to grow.
To mulch plants means to put a mulch round them to protect them and help them to grow.

example.ex: In May, mulch the bed with garden compost.

means.word_mean: 1. a protective covering of rotting vegetable matter spread to reduce evaporation and soil erosion
